atom
Class Entry

java.lang.Object
  atom.Entry
All Implemented Interfaces:
EasySAXParseable
public class Entry
extends Object
implements EasySAXParseable

Entry of an Atom 1.0 feed. The specification is at http://atompub.org/rfc4287.html.

getId

public String getId()

setId

public void setId(Object id)
The ID should be String. But often atom beans have Integer-IDs. So here the parameter's type is Object so that you can simply call entry.setId(Object).

Parameters:
id - the id to set

addSimpleExtElement

public void addSimpleExtElement(String tag,
                                String body)
Adds an extension element containing only text. The extension element is a simple extension element according Atom 1.0 spec at http://atompub.org/rfc4287.html. It has no attributes and no subelements. Therefore it is similar to a property: the tag is like the key and the body is like the value.

Parameters:
tag - The tag name of the new child element
body - Textual content of the extension element, not escaped.

addSimpleExtElement

public void addSimpleExtElement(String tag,
                                int number)
Adds an extension element containing only text representing an integer number.

Parameters:
tag - The tag name of the new child element
number -

addSimpleExtElement

public void addSimpleExtElement(String tag,
                                long number)
Adds an extension element containing only text representing a long number.

Parameters:
tag - The tag name of the new child element
number -

addSimpleExtElement

public void addSimpleExtElement(String tag,
                                Date date)
Adds an extension element containing only text representing a timestamp. The timestamp will be represented according to RTC 3339.

Parameters:
tag - The tag name of the new child element
date -

addSimpleExtElement

public void addSimpleExtElement(String tag,
                                boolean b)
Adds an extension element containing only text representing a boolean, which will appear as "true" or "false".

Parameters:
tag - The tag name of the new child element
b -

addNamespace

public void addNamespace(String prefix,
                         HttpURL url,
                         HttpURL schemaLocation)
Adds a namespace with schema location.

Parameters:
prefix - Your elements will be prefixed like that. May be "".
url - The unique URL that identifies the namespace
schemaLocation - The URL of the XML schema for this namespace

addNamespace

public void addNamespace(String prefix,
                         String url,
                         HttpURL schemaLocation)
Adds a namespace with schema location.

Parameters:
prefix - Your elements will be prefixed like that. May be "".
url - The unique URL that identifies the namespace
schemaLocation - The URL of the XML schema for this namespace

addNamespace

public void addNamespace(String prefix,
                         String url)
Adds a namespace without schema location. Adds attribute: xmlns:prefix = "url"

Parameters:
prefix - Your elements will be prefixed like that. May be "" or null for the default schema location.
url - The unique URL that identifies the namespace

addNamespace

public void addNamespace(String prefix,
                         String url,
                         String schemaLocation)
Adds a namespace with schema location.

Parameters:
prefix - Your elements will be prefixed like that. May be "".
url - The unique URL that identifies the namespace
schemaLocation - The URL of the XML schema for this namespace. Maybe null if we don't have it.

getNamespaces

public List<Namespace> getNamespaces()
Returns all the namespace declarations in this elements.

write

public void write(OutputStream os)
           throws TransformerException
Writes the feed to the output stream, using SAX. See http://java.sun.com/webservices/jaxp/dist/1.1/docs/tutorial/xslt/3_generate.html

Parameters:
os - OutputStream
Throws:
TransformerException
